svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - January 27 2024

title: "Week in Ethereum News
January 27, 2024" date: "2024-01-26"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade (meta EIP7569 )
• Final public testnets upgrade to Dencun Jan 30 (Sepolia) & Feb 7 (Holešky) Lightweight beaconcha.in
explorers: mainnet , Holešky & Sepolia
Final public testnets upgrade to Dencun Jan 30 (Sepolia) & Feb 7 (Holešky)
• Lightweight beaconcha.in explorers: mainnet , Holešky & Sepolia
• L2s testing blobs: RollCall (L2 standards) EIP4844 readiness call : L2s testing on Goerli or waiting
for Sepolia & improving communications with core devs OP & Base devnets posting batches via blobs on
Goerli testnet Starknet sent state diff blob on Goerli testnet
L2s testing blobs:
• RollCall (L2 standards) EIP4844 readiness call : L2s testing on Goerli or waiting for Sepolia &
improving communications with core devs
RollCall (L2 standards) EIP4844 readiness call : L2s testing on Goerli or waiting for Sepolia &
• OP & Base devnets posting batches via blobs on Goerli testnet
OP & Base devnets posting batches via blobs on Goerli testnet
• Starknet sent state diff blob on Goerli testnet
Starknet sent state diff blob on Goerli testnet
• Dencun interop testing call video : high memory usage after blob spamming, max churn limit (EIP7514)
will be tested on Goerli and first blobs expire on Goerli Feb 5
Dencun interop testing call video : high memory usage after blob spamming, max churn limit (EIP7514)
• EF DevOps Attacknet : chaos testing tooling, plan to open source after Dencun
EF DevOps Attacknet : chaos testing tooling, plan to open source after Dencun
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade (meta EIP7600 )
• Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim : Electra upgrade
scope (small cross layer fork targeting late 2024): Client team priorities : Lighthouse , Lodestar &
Prysm Electra EIPs : EIP6110 (validator deposits onchain), EIP7002 (EL triggerable exits) & EIP7549
(move committee index outside attestation) Not in Electra : EIP6914 (reuse validator indices)
Discussions ongoing : EIP7251 (increase max effective balance), EIP7547 (inclusion lists), EIP7594
(PeerDAS) & SSZification EIPs
• Electra upgrade scope (small cross layer fork targeting late 2024): Client team priorities :
Lighthouse , Lodestar & Prysm Electra EIPs : EIP6110 (validator deposits onchain), EIP7002 (EL
triggerable exits) & EIP7549 (move committee index outside attestation) Not in Electra : EIP6914
(reuse validator indices) Discussions ongoing : EIP7251 (increase max effective balance), EIP7547
(inclusion lists), EIP7594 (PeerDAS) & SSZification EIPs
• Client team priorities : Lighthouse , Lodestar & Prysm
Client team priorities : Lighthouse , Lodestar & Prysm
• Electra EIPs : EIP6110 (validator deposits onchain), EIP7002 (EL triggerable exits) & EIP7549 (move
committee index outside attestation)
Electra EIPs : EIP6110 (validator deposits onchain), EIP7002 (EL triggerable exits) & EIP7549 (move
• Not in Electra : EIP6914 (reuse validator indices)
Not in Electra : EIP6914 (reuse validator indices)
• Discussions ongoing : EIP7251 (increase max effective balance), EIP7547 (inclusion lists), EIP7594
Client releases for Sepolia & Holešky testnets Dencun upgrade
• Consensus layer: Lighthouse v4.6.0 Lodestar v1.15.0-rc.0 Nimbus v24.1.2 Prysm v4.2.1-rc.2 Teku

• Lighthouse v4.6.0

Teku
• Execution layer: Besu Erigon v2.57.1 Geth v1.13.11 Nethermind v1.25.3 Reth v0.1.0-alpha.16

• Besu
Besu
• Erigon v2.57.1
Erigon v2.57.1
Geth v1.13.11
• Nethermind v1.25.3
Nethermind v1.25.3

Reth v0.1.0-alpha.16
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
• 🚨 Lido at 31.84% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
🚨 Lido at 31.84% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
• Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth 78% supermajority, could cause a
chain split & lose your staked ETH Allnodes & P2P migrated to Besu Lido & Kiln reducing Geth usage
Coinbase & Kraken “taking a look” at client diversity Consensus layer: Prysm 39%, any client bug over
33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
• Execution layer: Geth 78% supermajority, could cause a chain split & lose your staked ETH Allnodes &
P2P migrated to Besu Lido & Kiln reducing Geth usage Coinbase & Kraken “taking a look” at client
diversity
Execution layer: Geth 78% supermajority, could cause a chain split & lose your staked ETH
• Allnodes & P2P migrated to Besu
Allnodes & P2P migrated to Besu
• Lido & Kiln reducing Geth usage
Lido & Kiln reducing Geth usage
• Coinbase & Kraken “taking a look” at client diversity
Coinbase & Kraken “taking a look” at client diversity
• Consensus layer: Prysm 39%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm 39%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
• Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America & Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
• Nethermind mainnet consensus issue on Jan 21, v1.23-1.25 were affected, patched
Nethermind mainnet consensus issue on Jan 21, v1.23-1.25 were affected, patched
• Data viz on whether we can increase the gas limit
Data viz on whether we can increase the gas limit
• Validator in-protocol consolidation in EIP7251 (increase max effective balance), to allow large
stakers to consolidate without having to fully exit validators & redeploy
Validator in-protocol consolidation in EIP7251 (increase max effective balance), to allow large
Research
• Potential changes to staking rewards & penalties to reduce issuance moderately at high staking
levels
For stakers
• Rated list of solo stakers in CSV format (first 500k indices)
Support the Roman Storm & Alex Pertsev legal defense fund
The Biden administration is attempting to criminalize open source software development as part of its
war on crypto.
Donate to defend our innocent Ethereum heroes . Retweet to spread awareness .
Layer 2
• RARI L3 (Arbitrum Orbit) live, with NFT royalty enforcement
RARI L3 (Arbitrum Orbit) live, with NFT royalty enforcement
• Public Goods Network, Aevo & Lyra (OP Stack) changed to Optimiums (sidechain DA)
Public Goods Network, Aevo & Lyra (OP Stack) changed to Optimiums (sidechain DA)
EIPs/Standards
• ERCs (application layer): ERC7601 : Dapp permission framework ERC7602 : Ethereum mixing transaction
supervision ERC7603 : Context-dependent multi-asset tokens (ERC1155 extension)
• ERC7601 : Dapp permission framework
ERC7601 : Dapp permission framework
• ERC7602 : Ethereum mixing transaction supervision
ERC7602 : Ethereum mixing transaction supervision
• ERC7603 : Context-dependent multi-asset tokens (ERC1155 extension)
ERC7603 : Context-dependent multi-asset tokens (ERC1155 extension)
Stuff for developers
• Solidity v0.8.24 : Cancun support (via EVM version flag): tstore & tload transient storage
(EIP1153), blobhash & blobbasefee (EIP4844) and mcopy (EIP5656) Apple silicon support
Solidity v0.8.24 :
• Cancun support (via EVM version flag): tstore & tload transient storage (EIP1153), blobhash &
blobbasefee (EIP4844) and mcopy (EIP5656)
Cancun support (via EVM version flag): tstore & tload transient storage (EIP1153), blobhash &
• Apple silicon support
Apple silicon support
• Mutexer : Solidity mutexes (contract, function & custom level), using Cancun transient storage
Mutexer : Solidity mutexes (contract, function & custom level), using Cancun transient storage
• Forge proposal simulator : framework to create proposals (multisig, timelock & Governor Bravo) and
deployment scripts/tests
Forge proposal simulator : framework to create proposals (multisig, timelock & Governor Bravo) and
• Ape (Python contract framework) custom network support
Ape (Python contract framework) custom network support
• CTFs: SmartSecRiddles : 7 challenges based on vulnerabilities with writeups Audit wizard find the
bug challenge
CTFs:
• SmartSecRiddles : 7 challenges based on vulnerabilities with writeups
SmartSecRiddles : 7 challenges based on vulnerabilities with writeups
• Audit wizard find the bug challenge
Audit wizard find the bug challenge
Security
• Concentric $1.7M exploit on Arbitrum using social engineering to compromise deployer
Ecosystem
• Academic paper on transparency & concentration in Ethereum governance
Academic paper on transparency & concentration in Ethereum governance

Job Listings
• Status is hiring: Technical Chief Operating Officer - Apply here
Status is hiring: Technical Chief Operating Officer - Apply here
• Nethermind: Distributed System Engineer , Lead Engineer , Protocol Researcher
Nethermind: Distributed System Engineer , Lead Engineer , Protocol Researcher
• ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
• EF seek an Executive Assistant to support senior decision makers
EF seek an Executive Assistant to support senior decision makers
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
• Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 6.3 to 82.4 gwei, with 17.6 gwei average Zero net issuance
currently at 22.0 gwei 4k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 6.3 to 82.4 gwei, with 17.6 gwei average
• Zero net issuance currently at 22.0 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 22.0 gwei
• 4k ETH net issuance this week
4k ETH net issuance this week
• ETHUSD : $2,186 - $2,491, currently $2,267
ETHUSD : $2,186 - $2,491, currently $2,267
• ETHBTC : currently 0.054 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.054 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
• Synthetix Perps v3 live on Base (Andromeda)
Synthetix Perps v3 live on Base (Andromeda)
• UMA Oval live on mainnet, protocols can capture oracle extractable value
UMA Oval live on mainnet, protocols can capture oracle extractable value
• 0x Tx Relay API live on mainnet, gasless swaps & approvals
0x Tx Relay API live on mainnet, gasless swaps & approvals
• Ethereum Attestation Service MetaMask Snap decodes EAS attestation data for signing
Ethereum Attestation Service MetaMask Snap decodes EAS attestation data for signing
Regulation/business/tokens
• SEC Twitter account compromised in January SIM swap had 2FA disabled since July 2023
General
• Support Roman Storm & Alex Pertsev legal defense via Juicebox fundraiser
Support Roman Storm & Alex Pertsev legal defense via Juicebox fundraiser
• USDT on Tron is majority of consumer stablecoin transactions & how Ethereum can compete

• Field Merkle Tree : commit multiple STARKs using binary Merkle Tree
Field Merkle Tree : commit multiple STARKs using binary Merkle Tree
• Apple fixed WebKit confusion zero day , update your devices
Apple fixed WebKit confusion zero day , update your devices
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup and
@evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
